Context:
The Board of Governors is the legal governing body of George Brown College. It consists of elected and appointed Governors in accordance with the Ontario Colleges of Applied Arts and Technology Act, 2002 and Regulation 34/03, and the college's By-law. The Board conducts its business through several committees: Academic and Student Affairs Committee, Finance and Property Committee, Audit committee, and Executive committee. The full Board meets regularly. The public is welcome to attend public sessions during the September to June term of operation.

The following are members of the current Board of Governors: Bruce Choy (Executive Vice President, Risk & Audit, Infrastructure Ontario), Nancy Prenevost (Head of Legal Affairs and Operational Compliance, Oxford Properties Group), Omo Akintan (Chief People Officer, University Pension Plan), Bhavna Duggal (CFO & Principal, The CFO Centre of Canada), Andrea Elliott (Executive Vice President, Direct to Consumer, Moose Knuckles), Saeideh Fard (Chief Financial Officer, Introhive), Rob Gilmour (Vice President, Crestview Strategy), Roger Grochmal (Retired CEO/Owner, AtlasCare), Arjun Jasuja (Founder and Chairman, Sigma Group), Millan Mulraine (Chief Economist, Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan), Gervan Fearon (President Ex Officio), Jon Callegher (Professor, Centre for Business, Faculty Representative), Ansh Jain (Student Representative), Peter Koutsokeris (Coordinator Orientation & Transition Programs, Support Staff Representative), and Akrivi Papadaki (Senior Manager, Strategic Planning, Administrative Staff Representative).

Emily Bain serves as the Secretary of the Board of Governors and can be contacted at boardsecretariat@georgebrown.ca. For further information about the college, visit their website or sign up for updates. The college can be reached at 416-415-2000 or TTY: 1-877-515-5559. Inquiries can also be sent to ask.george@georgebrown.ca.

The information on this website is subject to change without notice. It should not be viewed as a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
